title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,956.95 USD/T on December 24, 2025, up 0.32% from the previous day, with a 5.16% increase over the past month and 15.51% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures reached $2,950 per tonne, near a three-year high, amid concerns over low supply from China. The data was last updated on December 26, 2025.

title: Environmental protection-driven production restrictions intensified, coupled with high aluminum prices suppressing demand, the operating rate of downstream aluminum processors weakened to 60.8% - SMM Aluminum Processing Weekly Survey
summary: The weekly operating rate of domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell to 60.8% as of December 26, 2025, down 0.6 percentage points week-over-week. High aluminum prices suppressed demand, leading to cautious buying, while intensified environmental production restrictions in central China constrained operations. Export orders faced pressure from holiday slowdowns, with weak year-end stockpiling expected to persist.

title: Aluminium outlook 2026: Tight supply, structural demand may keep prices elevated
summary: Aluminum prices are closing 2025 near annual highs, supported by strong demand from electric vehicles, renewables, and electrification, alongside persistent supply constraints. Global inventories are at multi-year lows, with LME stocks down 20% year-on-year, positioning the market for a deficit into 2026. Demand is projected to grow 2.5% annually, sustaining elevated prices.

title: Environmental protection-driven production restrictions intensified, coupled with high aluminum prices suppressing demand; the operating rate of downstream aluminum processors weakened to 60.8% - SMM Aluminum Processing Weekly Survey
summary: The weekly operating rate of leading domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell 0.6 percentage points week-over-week to 60.8% due to weak orders, environmental protection controls, and high aluminum prices. Environmental protection-driven production restrictions escalated in central China, with a red alert for air pollution in Gongyi lasting until December 28, constraining production and transportation. Downstream sectors like aluminum alloy, wire, cable, and foil face ongoing pressure from slow orders and delayed stockpiling, with operating rates expected to remain weak.

title: China to rein in copper, alumina capacity expansion under next five-year plan
summary: China will tighten oversight of new copper and alumina projects from 2026 to 2030 to curb irrational investment and overcapacity, as it is the world’s largest producer of both. From January to November 2025, China produced 13.3 million metric tons of refined copper (up 9.8% year-over-year) and 84.7 million tons of alumina, both on track for records. This policy aims to address risks of unchecked expansion amid rising output.

title: Southeast Asian aluminum output expected to reach 2.7 million tons by 2026, but supply to remain tight in early year
summary: Primary aluminum production in Southeast Asia is projected to reach around 2.7 million tons by 2026, driven mainly by Indonesia's new and expanded smelting projects involving Chinese investors. However, supply will remain tight in Q1 2026 due to gradual capacity ramp-ups and strong export demand. Vietnam and Malaysia are also adding capacity, though Indonesia's coal reliance and local processing may limit exports.

title: Chinese firms drive aluminum expansion in Indonesia, raise surplus fears
summary: Chinese firms are expanding aluminum production in Indonesia, with output projected to rise from 815,000 tons in 2025 to 1.6 million tons in 2026 and 2.5 million tons in 2027, contributing to global surpluses of 1.5 million tons in 2026 and 2 million tons in 2027 per Goldman Sachs. This new supply offsets China's nearing 45 million ton capacity cap, potentially pushing prices down to $2,350 per metric ton by Q4 2026. Macquarie forecasts a smaller 390,000-ton surplus next year but deficits longer-term as demand grows.

title: Market trends, policy signals and innovation together suggest a recalibration within the global aluminium downstream industry
summary: Leadership changes, policy shifts like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), market trends, and innovations are driving structural changes in the global aluminium value chain ahead of 2026. Key highlights include growth in the aluminium foil industry with a projected CAGR of 5% through 2030 and a breakthrough by Nagoya University researchers in high-temperature resistant, recyclable aluminium alloys ideal for 3D printing in engines, turbines, and aerospace. These developments enhance competitiveness, resilience, and sustainability in the industry.

title: A run-through of 2025's aluminium recycling projects and initiatives contributing to decarbonisation and sustainability
summary: Novelis opened the Ulsan Aluminium Recycling Centre, the world’s largest, expected to reduce carbon emissions by 420,000 tonnes annually, equivalent to CO2 absorption by 19 million trees, with a joint venture investment of USD 65 million boosting low-carbon aluminium production. EGA’s Spectro Alloys advances recycled aluminium under the RevivAL brand, while a collaboration between Capral, Rio Tinto, and Sims Metal in Queensland enables closed-loop recycling of over 1,000 tonnes of aluminium with at least 20% recycled content. These initiatives promote low-carbon supply chains and scalable recycling solutions.

title: Aluminum vs Plastic in Packaging: Trends, Case Studies, Solutions, Technology, Industry Insights
summary: Aluminum packaging is gaining traction over plastic due to its infinite recyclability, 95% energy savings in recycling compared to primary production, and growth of 6.2% annually amid environmental scrutiny on plastics. Brands like Coca-Cola and Dove have switched to aluminum, supported by technologies such as gauge optimization, lightweighting tools, and advanced recycling processes that reduce material use and environmental impact. Aluminum aligns with 2025 sustainability trends, regulations, and consumer demands despite its high initial energy-intensive production.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,091 CNY/T on December 26, 2025, up 0.75% from the previous day, though down 0.06% over the past month and 5.45% year-over-year. Steel rebar futures in China stood at CNY 3,085 per tonne, set to close the year around 7% lower amid soft demand for ferrous metals. China's NBS Construction PMI indicated a fourth consecutive contraction.

title: US scrap trends outlook: December 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap market sentiment is neutral, with the Trend Indicator at 47.9, signaling a modest 1% price decline month-over-month due to mill outages, weak finished steel pricing, and stagnant economic activity. Sellers show mild optimism while buyers are bearish, with inventory levels slightly below average. No major supply or demand catalysts are evident in the near term.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 27.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures rebar contracts showing no change on December 26, 2025. Coverage includes indices, news, and analyses for various markets like Turkey, China, Europe, and North America. Users can track commodities via watch lists for the latest price changes.

title: December 2025 - Where Are Steel Prices Headed in 2026?
summary: A community poll of 444 industry professionals predicts cautious optimism for US steel prices in Q2 2026, with 65% expecting moderate to major rises and 35% forecasting flat or falling prices. The forecast reflects a significant split in market sentiment among insiders. Full results and deep dive available in the video.

title: China launches first million-tonne near-zero-carbon steel line
summary: China has completed its first million-tonne near-zero-carbon steel production line in Zhanjiang City, Guangdong Province, using a hydrogen-based metallurgical electric smelting process that replaces traditional coke with hydrogen. This technology reduces carbon emissions by 50 to 80 percent compared to conventional methods and can cut over 3.14 million tonnes of emissions annually. The project marks a major breakthrough in the steel industry's green transformation during the 14th Five-Year Plan period.

title: Steel inputs squeeze: Curbs on low-ash coke raise costs for makers
summary: India's steel capacity expansion faces pressure from restrictions on low-ash metallurgical coke imports, leading to supply shortages and higher costs for steelmakers. In the first half of 2025, steelmakers secured only 1.5 million tonnes of coke against demand exceeding 3 million tonnes, increasing reliance on domestic supply and risking production disruptions. LAM coke, accounting for 35-40% of steel production costs, has seen price rises that squeeze margins and affect competitiveness.

title: Turkish basic metal manufacturing capacity use up in Dec 2025 from Nov
summary: In December 2025, Turkey's basic metal manufacturing industry capacity utilization rate rose to 75.8 percent from 75.3 percent in November, though slightly above 75.7 percent in December 2024. The manufacture of metal products, except machinery and equipment, saw capacity utilization at 74.1 percent, up from 72.8 percent in November and 71.4 percent year-over-year. Overall manufacturing capacity utilization remained at 74.4 percent, down from 75.8 percent in December 2024.

title: China pledges to control steel output during 2026-2030 period
summary: China plans to control steel output during the 2026-2030 period amid ongoing production adjustments. In the first 11 months of 2025, crude steel output fell 4 percent year-over-year, positioning the annual total below 1 billion tonnes.

title: Russia expects 5pc drop steel output 2025
summary: Russia anticipates a 5 percent decline in steel output for 2025, reaching 67 million tonnes. This forecast comes from First Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov amid ongoing industry challenges.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper rose to 5.78 USD/Lbs on December 26, 2025, up 3.06% from the previous day, reaching a five-month high amid strong demand and supply constraints. The metal benefits from the global energy transition and a weaker US dollar, with prices up 41.80% year-over-year. Concerns over potential US tariffs in 2026 add to supply tightness risks.

title: Copper may test USD 13,500/ton by first half of 2026 amid supply constraints: Experts
summary: Copper prices are forecasted to reach USD 13,500 per ton by mid-2026 due to persistent global supply constraints from mine disruptions in Indonesia, Chile, and Peru. Robust US economic growth supports demand in copper-intensive sectors, while trade uncertainties and a weaker dollar boost speculative flows. Long-term demand from EVs, renewables, and AI infrastructure remains strong.

title: Copper price nears $12,000 as base metals stage broad rally
summary: Copper prices rallied to $11,928 a ton, nearing $12,000, driven by mine disruptions, US imports surge, and bullish AI-linked demand despite weak Chinese demand. Prices have climbed over a third this year, with nickel also advancing on Indonesia's planned production cuts. The rally reflects tightening supply across base metals.

title: Copper hits record high above USD12,000 a ton
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the LME reached a record USD12,039 per metric ton, up 1% in trading. The surge is attributed to supply squeezes and market dynamics pushing prices to new highs.

title: Copper Prices Surge Past $12000 a Ton, Setting New Record Amid Tariff Fears and Supply Squeeze
summary: Copper prices exceeded $12,000 per ton for the first time, fueled by US stockpiling ahead of potential tariffs and ongoing supply constraints. The record high underscores tightening global availability and heightened market tensions.

title: Beijing tightens reins on copper and alumina projects to stop disorderly expansion
summary: China's National Development and Reform Commission is tightening controls on new copper and alumina projects to prevent irrational investment and disorderly expansion from 2026 to 2030. From January to November 2025, China produced 13.3 million tonnes of refined copper, up 9.8% year-over-year, on track for a record. The policy emphasizes regional differences, mergers among large firms, and continued overseas mining investments.

title: China to rein in copper, alumina capacity expansion under next five-year plan
summary: China's NDRC announced tighter oversight on copper and alumina projects to curb overcapacity, requiring feasibility studies aligned with national policy. China produced 13.3 million metric tons of refined copper from January to November 2025, up 9.8%, with plans for 2 million tons of smelting capacity already suspended. The measures support industry consolidation and overseas investments amid strong production and rising prices.

title: Beyond Gold: Copper's Explosive Rise as AI and EVs Fuel Demand!
summary: Copper prices have surged 36% due to demand from AI data centers, electric vehicles, and supply disruptions, with analysts bullish citing Chinese buying and recommending mining stocks like Freeport McMoRan. Industrial metals rally reflects technology and energy transition trends. Uranium and cobalt also saw significant gains amid broader market strength.

title: Copper Hits $12K: Supply Crisis Drives Historic Rally
summary: Copper prices have exceeded $12,000 per tonne amid a supply crisis sparking a historic market rally. The surge is driven by ongoing supply-demand imbalances in production and capacity.

title: Hindustan Copper Surges as Global Copper Prices Hit 16-Year High
summary: Hindustan Copper's stock surged as global copper prices reached a 16-year high, reflecting strong market momentum. The price rally underscores tightening supply conditions in copper production.

title: Copper's Red Metal Revolution: Prices Target $12,000 Milestone Amid Supply Shocks and AI Demand
summary: Copper prices are surging toward a $12,000 per metric ton milestone due to supply shocks, AI-driven demand from data centers, and the green energy transition. Major miners like Southern Copper and Freeport-McMoRan benefit from low-cost operations, while mid-stream manufacturers face rising input costs. The rally is fueled by structural demand from EVs, renewables, and AI infrastructure, prompting investments in mine expansions and recycling.

title: Copper's Record-Breaking Rally: A Strategic Buy Opportunity Amid Tariffs, Supply Constraints & Energy Transition
summary: Copper prices reached an all-time high of $11,700 per metric ton in December 2025, driven by mine outages, refining bottlenecks, tariffs, and surging demand from the energy transition, EVs, and AI data centers. EVs require 3-4 times more copper than traditional vehicles, with global consumption projected to grow over 35% by 2035. A supply deficit of 330kmt persists, positioning copper as essential for net-zero goals amid physical bottlenecks.

title: Nickel Morning Post on December 27th
summary: Shanghai nickel futures closed at 126,370 RMB/ton, up 0.48%, amid stable high levels following the London Metal Exchange reopening after Christmas. Market trading remains quiet with basic metals in range fluctuations due to low liquidity. The 2025 trend may depend on geopolitical developments and Federal Reserve interest rate policies.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel traded flat at 15,660 USD/T on December 26, 2025, with a 5.53% rise over the past month and 2.32% year-over-year increase. UK nickel futures surged to $15,600 per tonne, the highest since May, after hitting four-year lows, as Indonesia proposes a 34% output cut in 2026 to address oversupply. Forecasts predict prices at 14,874 USD/MT by quarter-end and 14,072 USD/MT in 12 months.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the LME amid stronger dollar and higher financing costs from fewer expected Fed rate cuts in 2025. Indonesia considers deep cuts to nickel mining quotas to boost slumping prices, offsetting market gloom. Prices are down 8% year-to-date due to new Indonesian supply and slowing EV sales.

title: Daily Nickel price, LME SHFE Price of Nickel live
summary: SMM reports #1 Jinchuan Nickel at 16,790.92 USD/mt on Dec 26, with high-grade NPI averaging 904 yuan/mtu, up 5 yuan MoM, showing bottom support and short-term upside potential. Various nickel premiums and prices listed, including import nickel at 15,946.96 USD/mt. Includes review of nickel ore for 2025 and outlook for 2026.

title: Talon buys nation's only nickel mine to create Midwest 'powerhouse'
summary: Talon Metals announced the purchase of the Eagle nickel mine in Michigan's Upper Peninsula and a nearby mill from Lundin Mining, aiming to expand nickel and copper production across the Midwest. The deal positions Talon as the only operating primary nickel-copper company in the US with expansion potential, including the Tamarack project. Lundin will hold nearly 20% stake in Talon as part of the transaction.

title: Talon Metals to Acquire Lundin Mining's Eagle Mine and Humboldt Mill Operations, Creating a Multi-Asset U.S. Nickel-Copper Company
summary: Talon Metals is acquiring the cash-flow-positive Eagle Mine and Humboldt Mill from Lundin Mining to form a unified US nickel-copper platform with exploration and expansion opportunities. The move advances priorities like extending Eagle's mine life, exploring in Michigan and Minnesota, and permitting the Tamarack Nickel-Copper Project. It addresses US dependence on foreign critical minerals for defense and energy.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority (AGCM) has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted yesterday at company offices, supported by Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% following the news, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
